title: Champions League: Man City cruise into quarters, as Real Madrid 'suffer' in draw
description: The two European powerhouses have now secured their spot in the quarter-finals alongside Bayern Munich and Paris Saint-Germain; the remaining qualifiers will be determined next week.

title: 2024 US presidential election: Nikki Haley drops out but doesn't endorse Donald Trump
description: Super Tuesday was fatal to Haley, who only won two primaries and never presented herself as an 'anti-Trump' candidate. Biden, meanwhile, has reached out to her electors.

title: Senegal: Confusion surrounds new date for presidential election
description: President Macky Sall sparked a political crisis in early February by postponing the December 15 election, only to be overruled by the Constitutional Council. The government advanced on Wednesday the date of March 24 for the vote, moments before being contradicted, once again, by the top constitutional body.

title: DR Congo: Over 100,000 more displaced in clashes
description: The escalation underscores the deepening humanitarian crisis gripping the region, demanding urgent attention to protect civilian lives and address the underlying causes of the conflict.

title: Zelensky and Greece's prime minister visited Odesa as it was rocked by a blast
description: The blast, a large explosion that the Russian military claimed as an attack on a hangar 'in which crewless cutters were being prepared for combat use,' was described as 'a very intense experience' by visiting Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis.

title: Sham marriages, false papers: Ukrainians' frantic quest to dodge the draft
description: Instead of risking their lives by attempting to cross the border illegally, men are increasingly turning to other methods to avoid mobilization.

title: Images of the catastrophic situation in Haiti, under the threat of 'civil war' from a gang leader
description: Amid reports of kidnappings, snipers on rooftops, and sexual violence, the UN Security Council will hold an emergency meeting on the escalation of violence in Haiti, where a gang leader has threatened 'civil war' if Prime Minister Ariel Henry does not resign.

title: US Democrat challenger Dean Phillips ends primary run and endorses Biden
description: Representative Dean Phillips, 55, a Democrat from Minnesota who had campaigned on a platform calling for a new generation of Democratic leadership, has ended his long-shot presidential bid after President Joe Biden's sweeping Super Tuesday victory.

title: Paris Olympics 2024: Police allegedly cracking down on sex workers before the Games
description: A group of 17 non-government organizations have issued a report decrying a 'repression first' approach, employed by French police towards sex workers ahead of the 2024 Paris Olympic Games, which they claim harms 'the security and health of sex workers.'

title: Israel-Hamas war: Even Gaza's graveyards have suffered destruction
description: Nearly half the burial sites in the Palestinian enclave have suffered damage by armored vehicles, air strikes and artillery fire from the Israeli army.

title: New York will deploy National Guard in subway after string of violent crimes
description: The New York governor announced that 1,000 New York State Police, MTAPD and the New York National Guard will be used to support the NYPD in conducting bag checks.

title: Digital Markets Act: How the way you use Google Maps and Messenger is changing
description: New European Union regulation on digital markets is being enforced as of Wednesday, March 6, leading tech giants to modify certain functions of their services, with concrete effects on their European users' experience.

title: Senate Republican Leader Mitch McConnell endorses Trump for president
description: His announcement marked quite the turnaround as McConnell had previously blamed Donald Trump for 'disgraceful' acts in the January 6 2021 Capitol insurrection.

title: Russia journalist jailed for seven years for criticizing Ukraine war
description: Roman Ivanov was found guilty of spreading 'false information' on social media about Russia's armed forces and punished under Moscow's strict military censorship laws.

title: Russia adds chess legend Kasparov to 'terrorists and extremists' list
description: The former world chess champion has been a vocal opponent of Putin and has repeatedly spoken out against the military offensive in Ukraine.

title: Nikki Haley suspends her campaign leaving Trump as only Republican candidate
description: The former South Carolina governor and ambassador to the UN did not endorse her rival in her post-Super Tuesday speech.

title: Head of France's national cinema agency to be tried for sexual assault in June
description: Dominique Boutonnat, 54, was accused of sexually assaulting his godson in 2020. Despite this accusation, Boutonnat had been reappointed as the head of France's powerful National Centre of Cinema (CNC) in 2022.

title: UN: 2023 was deadliest year for migrants in a decade
description: With nearly 8,600 deaths, a 20% increase on 2022 figures, 2023 was the deadliest year for migrants since records began to be kept by the UN's International Organization for Migration in 2014.

title: France and Moldova set to sign a defense cooperation pact
description: French President Emmanuel Macron and Moldovan leader Maia Sandu will sign a defense cooperation agreement in Paris on Thursday.

title: Spain prosecutors seek jail for Real Madrid coach Ancelotti over alleged failure to declare earnings
description: The prosecutors are calling for Carlo Ancelotti to be jailed for four years and nine months, saying he failed to declare more than €1 million in earnings to the tax office.

title: At Roman Polanski's defamation trial, defense blames '#MeToo and its alternative accountability'
description: The filmmaker was sued for defamation after calling actress Charlotte Lewis, who accused him of rape, a liar. His lawyers pleaded for acquittal in the name of the right to defend an 'accused person thrown to the wolves.'

title: Gaza: Israel's unjustifiable scorched-earth policy
description: Five months after Israel began its response to the massacre of civilians by Hamas militiamen, the narrow strip of Palestinian land has been rendered largely uninhabitable. It is pointless to invoke the two-state solution if this martyred territory remains a field of ruins.

title: Yulia Navalnaya calls for election day protest against Vladimir Putin
description: The widow of the late Russian opposition leader called for protestors to form long queues in an attempt to overload voting stations on March 6.

title: French finance minister: 'Reducing state spending by €10 billion is a first step'
description: In an interview with Le Monde, Bruno Le Maire details the steps the French government will take to reduce public spending and simplify administrative procedures.

title: 'The debate over sending troops to Ukraine reveals profound differences in allies' approach to warfare'
description: The stalemate in the Ukrainian conflict and President Macron's call for a 'strategic surge' in dealing with Russia is forcing Westerners, united in their goal of defeating Moscow, to confront their cultural differences over the role each should play, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Super Tuesday: In North Carolina, voters confirm Trump's grip on the GOP
description: The former president clinched a predictable victory in the state on Tuesday. But the vote was more notable for the nomination of Mark Robinson, a candidate known for his anti-LGBTQ and antisemitic rhetoric, in the gubernatorial race.

title: Biden and Trump head for another face-off, after a surprise-less Super Tuesday
description: The former president triumphed, confirming his stranglehold on the Republican Party and crushing his rival, Nikki Haley, who won only the state of Vermont.

title: Terrorism remains the key challenge at the Paris 2024 Games
description: Speaking before the Senate, French Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin disclosed that one million security investigations will be carried out between now and the start of the Olympics, among other initiatives.

title: Kharkiv is targeted by both Russian missiles and misinformation
description: Just a few kilometers from the Russian border, Ukraine's second-largest city has been relentlessly targeted by enemy missiles and drones. According to its mayor, a 'second phase' of the war has also begun via Telegram channels.

title: Senegal: Opposition leader Ousmane Sonko, first to be released under partial amnesty?
description: The government's bill is scheduled for review and voting by MPs by Wednesday. However, the text, intended to alleviate political tensions stemming from the postponement of the presidential election, is already facing criticism.

title: Biden and Trump secure Super Tuesday victories, moving closer to a November rematch
description: Trump's longshot challenger, former UN ambassador Nikki Haley, has so far failed to provide a significant obstacle in the former's president path to the nomination, losing every state in the Super Tuesday election.

title: Haiti: State of emergency declared in the capital plagued by gang violence, 'Everyone is afraid.'
description: The government has declared a 72-hour state of emergency in the city of Port-au-Prince, which has been gripped by a surge in violence since February 29. Heavily armed gangs aiming to overthrow Prime Minister Ariel Henry are behind the escalation.
